alert.note: Alert for Yavapai (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 4:31PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of Yavapai County near Chino Valley. * WHEN...Until 730 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. Ponding of water on highways and in populated areas will create hazardous travel conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 430 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms between Paulden and Chino Valley. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Butte Wash, Granite Creek, Little Chino Valley, Dillon Wash, Williamson Valley Wash, Cooper Wash, Big Chino Wash and Mint Wash. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chino Valley. - This includes the following highways... State Route 89 between mile markers 327 and 336. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding of washes and creeks will occur, some dirt roads will become muddy and impassable. Paved roads and underpasses could become flooded as well.
